parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF:11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandated for campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post does not explicitly mention a specific parliamentary candidate by name or surname. However, the presence of the CMF number and the clear focus on political issues related to governance and policy strongly suggest an indirect reference to a political party or group.  Further investigation is needed to determine the affiliation of the CMF number.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content addresses broad societal issues and policy proposals, not a specific individual.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's objective appears to be to promote a political vision and platform. While not explicitly urging voters to vote for a specific candidate, the detailed policy proposals and the CMF number strongly suggest an intention to influence voters' choices in the upcoming elections. The overall message aims to garner support for the political ideology presented.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not adhere to journalistic standards. It lacks objectivity and presents a partisan viewpoint, promoting specific policy proposals without critical analysis or counterarguments.  It's presented as a political manifesto, not a news report.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured presentation of policy proposals, clearly intended for political campaigning.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2234871730229952</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The presence of a CMF number, the targeting of a specific geographical area (Bistrița-Năsăud County), the detailed policy proposals, and the paid advertisement format all strongly indicate that this Facebook post constitutes electoral propaganda. While it doesn't explicitly name a candidate, the indirect nature of the promotion, coupled with the CMF number, makes it highly likely that this is an attempt to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections. The post's extensive policy platform is designed to appeal to voters and promote a specific political agenda.  The counter-argument would be that the post focuses on general political issues and doesn't directly advocate for a specific candidate. However, the CMF number and the targeted nature of the advertisement outweigh this argument.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Lorand Toth</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Lorand Toth], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 2234871730229952) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care conține propagandă electorală indirectă, dar evidentă, prin prezentarea unui program de guvernare detaliat și a unui număr CMF (CMF:11240015),  având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea USR,  în ciuda lipsei unei menționări explicite a unui candidat.  Postarea, fiind o reclamă plătită, vizează o audiență largă din județul Bistrița-Năsăud,  constituind astfel o încălcare clară a prevederilor legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
